content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Sure, here is a simple function in Julia that implements the described behavior:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    function is_capitalized(word)
        return isuppercase(first(word))
    end

    function filter_word(word)
        if is_capitalized(word)
            return true
        else
            return false
        end
    end

    return filter(filter_word, words)
end
```

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
julia> words = ["Dog", "cat", "Julia", "programming"]
4-element Array{String,1}:
 "Dog"
 "cat"
 "Julia"
 "programming"

julia> keep_only_names(words)
2-element Array{String,1}:
 "Dog"
 "Julia"
```

This function defines two helper functions `is_capitalized` and `filter_word` to make the code more readable. The `is_capitalized` function checks if the first
